metadata.Title: CVE-2022-42898 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: PAC parsing in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.19.4 and 1.20.x before 1.20.1 has integer overflows that may lead to remote code execution (in KDC, kadmind, or a GSS or Kerberos application server) on 32-bit platforms (which have a resultant heap-based buffer overflow), and cause a denial of service on other platforms. This occurs in krb5_pac_parse in lib/krb5/krb/pac.c. Heimdal before 7.7.1 has "a similar bug."

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Per upstream Samba advisory, this is only an issue on 32-bit systems. rodrigo-zaiden> a regression in heimdal was reported by samba and fixed in https://github.com/heimdal/heimdal/pull/1025 mdeslaur> See samba bug for samba regression fix not yet commited The focal samba update was temporarily reverted by USN 5822-2 because it introduced regressions. It was later updated again with USN 5936-1.

criterions.comment: heimdal: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
krb5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
samba: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
